senses.sense_definition: Having or relating to a stigma (a part of a flower) or stigmata (religious marks).

examples.text: The <w>stigmatic</w> surface of the orchid is designed to trap pollen effectively.
Historians analyzed the <w>stigmatic</w> phenomena reported in the lives of medieval saints.

senses.sense_definition: Marked with a stigma or characterized by disgrace; stigmatized.

examples.text: He struggled to overcome the <w>stigmatic</w> label placed upon him by society.
The <w>stigmatic</w> nature of the disease prevented many from seeking early treatment.

senses.sense_definition: A person who displays stigmata, the bodily marks resembling the five wounds of Christ.

examples.text: Pilgrims traveled from afar to receive a blessing from the famous <w>stigmatic</w>.
The church conducted a thorough investigation to determine if the <w>stigmatic</w> was genuine.

senses.sense_definition: A person who has been branded or marked as a criminal or outcast.

examples.text: In ancient times, a <w>stigmatic</w> would often be exiled from the community.
He lived as a <w>stigmatic</w>, forever bearing the mark of his crime on his skin.
